sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS May 11, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of EXPRESS SCRIPTS HOLDING COMPANY, a Delaware corporation (the Company or Express Scripts), will be held at the principal executive offices of the Company, One Express Way, Saint Louis, Missouri 63121, on Thursday, May 11, 2017, at 8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Time (the meeting), to consider and act upon the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Items of Business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. to elect twelve (12) directors to serve until the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until their respective successors are elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accountants for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. to approve, by non-binding vote, the Companys executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. to recommend, by non-binding vote, the frequency of executive compensation votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. to consider two stockholder proposals, if properly presented at the meeting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. to transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record at the close of business on March 13, 2017 are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least ten days prior to the meeting, a complete list of stockholders entitled to vote will be available for inspection by any stockholder for any purpose germane to the meeting, during ordinary business hours, at the office of the Secretary of the Company at One Express Way, Saint Louis, Missouri 63121.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a stockholder of record, you are cordially invited to attend the meeting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of whether you expect to be present at the meeting, please either complete, sign and date the enclosed proxy card and mail it promptly in the enclosed envelope, or vote electronically by telephone or the Internet as described in greater detail in the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Returning the enclosed proxy card or voting electronically or telephonically will not affect your right to vote in person if you attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Martin P. Akins Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary One Express Way Saint Louis, Missouri 63121 March 17, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even though you may plan to attend the meeting in person, please vote by telephone or the Internet, or execute the enclosed proxy card and mail it promptly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A return envelope (which requires no postage if mailed in the United States) is enclosed for your convenience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone and Internet voting information is provided on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should you attend the meeting in person, you may revoke your proxy and vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Letter to Stockholders from the Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board continues to maintain a focus on effective corporate governance and high ethical standards, which we believe are important to the Company and protect the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Lead Independent Director of Express Scripts, I would like to share my perspective on several critical matters that reflect our Boards governance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the leadership of our Corporate Governance Committee, our Board consistently reviews and considers our governance policies to ensure they meet the needs of the Company and the expectations of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples of these best practices are discussed on page 18 of the Proxy Statement, many of which reflect the direct input of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage and appreciate meaningful discussions with our stockholders and believe this mutual dialogue is an essential component of our Boards governance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, following discussion and engagement with a number of stockholders, in 2016, our Board unanimously adopted proxy access  a procedure that we believe is a mark of good governance and enhances our accountability to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Structure and Strategic Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has selected George Paz, the Companys former Chief Executive Officer, to serve as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this Board structure is in the best long-term interests of our stockholders, as Mr. Paz holds deep industry and Company knowledge and a unique strategic perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has also selected me to serve as the Lead Independent Director, a position that I am honored to hold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the Lead Independent Director, I am directly involved in key corporate decisions, including those involving strategic direction, executive leadership and governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I regularly hold executive sessions with the other independent members of the Board and am empowered to call further meetings as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During these sessions, the independent Board members engage in meaningful discussion about important corporate and strategic matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am also involved in setting and ultimately approve meeting agendas for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Lead Independent Director role has been and will continue to be an effective means for strengthening our corporate governance processes, empowering our independent directors and enhancing the overall functioning of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Composition and Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that broad-based diversity is an important attribute of a well-functioning Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am pleased that our Board reflects a diverse and highly engaged group of individuals with the experience and background necessary to oversee management effectively (see page 9 of our Proxy Statement for examples of our Boards diversity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanding female representation in the near term is also a top priority for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed our executive compensation program to align the interests of our senior leadership with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I am pleased to report that, in 2016, for the fifth year in a row, our executive compensation program received over 93% support from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program is primarily overseen by the Compensation Committee with general oversight of the Board, and we will continue to promote an executive compensation program that appropriately balances risk and reward, incentivizes long-term performance and does not encourage excessive or unnecessary risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Workforce Diversity and Inclusion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that a diverse workforce with fair and equal opportunities for compensation and advancement is essential to driving strong performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have long supported diversity and equality in all areas of our business, including hiring and compensation, and I am proud that Express Scripts has been named a leader among Fortune 25 companies with a workforce that is 69% female and 39% minority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 45% of our leaders (director level or higher) are female and our commitment to diversity has been publicly recognized by Human Rights Campaign Foundation (100% on the 2017 Corporate Equality Index) and by DiversityInc (listed as top 25 noteworthy company for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I believe that our diverse and highly engaged Board continues to represent our stockholders in a manner that promotes the highest ethical standards and governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I encourage our stockholders to remain engaged in order to support our common goal of promoting the long-term value of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tom Mac Mahon Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEY ELEMENTS OF OUR COMPENSATION PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Element     Purpose     Key Characteristics                 Fixed Component       Base Salary      Provides a pay opportunity that is generally competitive with the companies with which we compete for talent      Determined by responsibility, level of position, competitive pay assessment and individual performance                   Performance- Based Component     Annual Performance-Based Cash Bonus Awards        Rewards the achievement of operational and other performance goals   Motivates performance by delivering greater rewards for superior Company and individual performance, while delivering reduced or no awards for Company or individual underperformance      An annual cash award, the payout of which is subject to a minimum EPS target and the discretion of the Compensation Committee                       Long-Term Incentive Equity Awards     Stock Options       Aligns compensation to long-term stockholder value and stock price appreciation       3-year ratable vesting   10-year expiration period                          Restricted Stock Units      Aligns compensation to long-term stockholder value and stock price appreciation      3-year ratable vesting                          Performance Shares    Rewards the achievement of long-term financial goals and value creation to our stockholders    Vest based on the Companys performance over three years in two equally weighted categories:    Relative Total Stockholder Return    Average Return on Invested Capital
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: xecutive Compensation Program Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to drive performance towards achievement of both short-term and long-term goals and to increase stockholder value, while appropriately balancing risk and reward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly review our compensation program to incorporate best practices, examples of which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: target total direct compensation that is generally competitive with a peer group of companies and other companies with which we compete for talent        a prohibition on pledging and trading in derivatives with respect to our common stock     a mix of short- and long-term performance incentives, with emphasis on long-term performance        a clawback policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: no tax gross-ups for our senior executives

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that the Corporate Governance Committee will nominate candidates for our Board who possess the highest personal and professional ethics, integrity and values, and who are committed to representing the long-term interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we have not adopted a formal policy on diversity, the Corporate Governance Committee considers the diversity, age, skills, and experience of the candidates in the context of the overall needs of the Board.

sentences.text: Leadership Structure of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Paz has served as the Chairman of our Board since May 2006 and also served as our CEO from April 2005 to May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe continuing this Board leadership structure is in the best interests of our stockholders as Mr. Paz is uniquely positioned to lead our Board with his exceptional depth of knowledge about Express Scripts and the opportunities and challenges we face.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As our former CEO, Mr. Paz provides valuable industry and strategic perspective to our independent Board and to Mr. Mac Mahon in his role as our Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wentworth assumed the role of our CEO in May 2016 and, as stated in the Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board prefers the role of CEO and Chairman of the Board to be split following a transition of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide for a Lead Independent Director of the Board at such times as the position of Chairman of the Board is held by a non-independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following Mr. Pazs retirement as our CEO in May 2016, Mr. Mac Mahon remained the Lead Independent Director, a position he has held since May 2008 (formerly identified as Presiding Director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In his role as Lead Independent Director, Mr. Mac Mahon is involved in all significant corporate decisions, including decisions regarding strategic direction, executive leadership, and governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mac Mahon chairs separate executive sessions of the independent directors at each Board meeting and approves the Board meeting agenda in advance of each meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the specified duties of the Lead Independent Director include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman of the Board is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as liaison between the Chairman of the Board and the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the authority to approve the nature and extent of information and data sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the authority to approve meeting agendas for the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the authority to approve meeting schedules to assure there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the authority to call meetings of the independent directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if requested by major stockholders, ensuring availability for consultation and direct communication with such stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our governance structure provides effective oversight of the Board because:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we have a strong, Lead Independent Director who provides substantive and meaningful contribution to our Companys most important decisions, including those involving strategic direction, executive leadership, and governance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Board has established and follows robust Corporate Governance Guidelines, as discussed below;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each member of the Board, other than Mr. Wentworth and Mr. Paz, is independent as defined by the listing standards of The Nasdaq Global Select Market;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each standing committee of the Board is composed solely of independent directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our Lead Independent Director holds regular meetings of our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Practices and Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Company is committed to the values of effective corporate governance and high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These values are conducive to long-term performance and the Board reevaluates our policies on an ongoing basis to ensure they sufficiently meet the Companys needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance procedures include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a majority voting standard for the uncontested election of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority threshold for stockholders to amend our bylaws;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a strong and empowered Lead Independent Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the ability of stockholders to call a special meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) provisions allowing for proxy access by stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) the stated preference that upon a transition of the CEO, the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO should be split.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have not adopted a stockholder rights plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our key corporate governance and ethics policies enable us to manage our business in accordance with the highest standards of business practice and in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines and Committee Charters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines to outline our corporate governance structure and address significant corporate governance issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee reviews our Corporate Governance Guidelines at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of these Guidelines as well as the Charter for each committee of our Board can be found at the Investor Relations  Governance  Corporate Governance Documents section of our website at www.express-scripts.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a Code of Ethics which applies to all of our directors, executive officers, and employees, including our senior financial officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Code of Ethics is available at the Investor Relations  Governance  Corporate Governance Documents section of our website at www.express-scripts.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will post any amendments to the Code of Ethics or any waivers of the Code of Ethics for any of our directors, executive officers or senior financial officers, in the same section of our website.

sentences.text: Selection of Nominees for the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Committee Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for evaluating potential candidates to serve on our Board and for recommending nominees to be presented for election or reelection to the Board at our annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating potential director candidates, including incumbent directors, the Corporate Governance Committee considers the skills and characteristics possessed by each candidate in the context of the perceived needs of the Board in an effort to ensure there is a blend of skills and experience that will enhance the effectiveness of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the factors considered by the Corporate Governance Committee are the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees relevant professional skills and depth of business experience;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees character, judgment, and personal and professional integrity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees ability to read and understand corporate financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees willingness to commit sufficient time to attend to his or her duties and responsibilities as a member of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees qualifications for membership on certain committees of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any potential conflicts of interest involving the nominee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the composition and diversity of our existing Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board has not adopted a formal policy on diversity, the Corporate Governance Committee considers the diversity, age, skills, and experience of candidates in the context of the overall needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee evaluates diversity in a broad sense, recognizing the benefits of racial and gender diversity, but also considering the breadth of backgrounds, professional skills, and business experiences that directors and candidates may bring to our Board (see page 9 for examples of our Boards diversity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In identifying potential candidates for the Board, the Corporate Governance Committee relies on recommendations from a number of possible sources, including current directors and officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee may also retain outside consultants or search firms to help identify potential candidates for membership on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee will also consider candidates recommended by stockholders on the same basis as other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of Candidates by Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder wishing to recommend a candidate for consideration by the Corporate Governance Committee to become a nominee for election to the Board may do so by submitting a written recommendation to the Corporate Governance Committee in accordance with our procedures for the submission of future stockholder proposals, as set out in our bylaws (see Other Matters  Future Stockholder Proposals  Proposals and Nominations Not for Inclusion in Proxy Statement on page 73).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a nominee to be considered for election, the nominee must provide the questionnaire and the representation and agreement described in the Future Stockholder Proposals section, and must describe various matters regarding the nominee and the recommending stockholder (including their associates and affiliates or others acting in concert and the underlying beneficial owner, if any) including, among other things, the following information:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the name, age, address and principal occupation or employment of both the nominee and the recommending stockholder;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nominees general biographical information, including the identification of any other boards on which the nominee serves
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with respect to our common stock, the current ownership information for both the nominee and the recommending stockholde
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of any transactions or relationships between the nominee and/or the recommending stockholder on the one hand, and our Company or our management on the other hand;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of any material proceedings that are adverse to our Company and to which the nominee or the recommending stockholder is a party;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of all agreements, arrangements and understandings between the recommending stockholder and the nominee pursuant to which the nomination is made;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of any rights to vote or acquire shares of our common stock together with a description of any other derivative securities related to shares of our common stock held by the recommending stockholder;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: such other information as may reasonably be required by the Company to determine the eligibility of the nominee to serve as an independent director or that could be material to a reasonable stockholders understanding of the independence, or lack thereof, of such nominee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other information relating to the nominee or the recommending stockholder that is required to be disclosed in solicitations for proxies for election of directors pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and the rules and regulations thereunder (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The request for nomination must also be accompanied by a written consent from the proposed nominee authorizing his or her nomination and agreeing to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Secretary will review all such stockholder recommendations and will forward those that comply with the above-described requirements to the Corporate Governance Committee for evaluation and consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, we amended our bylaws to permit a holder (or a group of not more than 20 holders) of at least 3% of our outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years to nominate and include in our proxy materials director nominees constituting up to the greater of two individuals or 20% of the Board, provided that the nominating holder(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in the bylaws, including providing us advance notice of the nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more detailed information on how to submit a nominee for inclusion in our proxy materials pursuant to the proxy access provisions, see Other Matters  Future Stockholder Proposals  Director Nominees for Inclusion in Proxy Statement (Proxy Access) on page 73.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of our directors is determined by the Corporate Governance Committee and ratified by the Board with input from the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of our non-employee director compensation program is to attract highly-qualified ndividuals to serve on the Board and to appropriately align the interests of our directors with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee and the Compensation Committee review the director compensation program periodically to ensure that it continues to meet these objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to determine whether the director compensation program is competitive, the Corporate Governance Committee and the Compensation Committee consider general market information on program design as well as the significant amount of time that directors expend in fulfilling their

(FWC), and an analysis of current market practice, the Corporate Governance Committee approved, and the Board ratified, certain changes to our non-employee director compensation program, including the elimination of meeting fees and changes to the retainer component of the compensation program for our non-employee directors.

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines establish a minimum level of stock ownership that is sufficient, in the judgment of the Corporate Governance Committee, to closely align the interests of our directors with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, after considering input from FWC, and an analysis of current market practice (and in connection with the revision to the compensation program for our non-employee directors discussed above), the Corporate Governance Committee approved, and the Board ratified, certain changes to the stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are currently expected to maintain stock ownership with a value equal to at least $400,000 (or four times the annual cash retainer for non-employee directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to March 2016, directors were expected to maintain stock ownership with a value equal to at least $150,000 (or 1.5 times the notional value of our annual equity grant to non-employee directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stock owned free and clear is included in determining compliance with this threshold (i.e., unexercised stock options and unvested restricted stock units are not included).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are given five years to meet this threshold, provided that, as a result of the greater ownership threshold adopted in March 2016, directors serving on the Board as of March 2016 have two years to meet the requirement (in addition to the initial five years for directors who have joined the Board since March 2011).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a director meets the threshold, if the value of the stock held by such director falls below the required ownership level due to a decrease in the trading price of our stock, such director has two years to remedy the shortfall.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While these guidelines are not mandatory, each directors status with respect to stock ownership is reviewed annually and communicated to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our directors is currently in compliance with these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Role in Enterprise Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has general oversight responsibility for our affairs, including risk management, while senior executives of the Company are responsible for our day-to-day operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to assist the Board in overseeing risk management, we have implemented enterprise risk management or ERM, which is a company-wide initiative that involves the Board in an oversight capacity, as well as our senior executives and other personnel acting in an integrated effort to identify, assess and manage risks that may affect our ability to execute on our corporate strategy and fulfill our business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These activities involve the identification, prioritization
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and assessment of a broad range of risks (e.g., financial, operational, business, reputational, governance and managerial), and the formulation of plans to manage these risks or mitigate their effects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXPRESS SCRIPTS HOLDING COMPANY  Proxy Statement    23

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management provides regular updates to our Board with respect to key risks, which allows the Board to oversee the formulation and mplementation of plans to manage these risks or mitigate their effects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly (and at least annually) discusses enterprise risk with management and reviews the structure of our existing risk management practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, our Audit Committee regularly (and at least annually) discusses with our management and internal audit team our major enterprise risks and the steps that have been taken to monitor and control such exposures, including a discussion of our risk assessment and risk management practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Compensation Committee regularly reviews risks related to our compensation policies and practices, and, at least annually, reviews and discusses the relationship between our risk management policies, corporate objectives, and compensation arrangements.

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Related Person Transaction Policy which requires all Related Person Transactions to be approved by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy is reviewed periodically by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, a Related Person is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any person who has served as an executive officer, director or director nominee of the Company at any time since the beginning of the last fiscal year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any person beneficially owning in excess of 5% of any class of the Companys voting securities; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) an immediate family member of any person described in clause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, a Related Person Transaction is any transaction, arrangement or relationship, or series of similar transactions, arrangements or relationships
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) involving an amount that exceeds or is expected to exceed $120,000 in the aggregate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in which the Company or its subsidiaries was, is, or will be a participant; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in which a Related Person had, has, or will have a direct or indirect material interest, other than:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any compensation arrangement with one of our executive officers if the Board or appropriate Board committee approved such compensation arrangement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any compensation paid to one of our directors if the compensation is approved by the Board or appropriate Board committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction where the Related Persons interest arises solely from the ownership of our securities and all holders of the same class of securities receive the same benefit on a pro rata basis (e.g. dividends);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction with another company at which a Related Persons only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer), director or beneficial owner of less than 10% of that companys shares, if the aggregate amount involved over any 12-month period does not exceed the greater of $200,000, or 2% of that companys total annual revenues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any charitable contribution, grant, or endowment by the Company to a charitable organization, foundation or university at which a Related Persons only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer) or a director, if the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the greater of $200,000, or 2% of the charitable organizations total annual receipts;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transactions available to all employees generally and conducted on similar terms;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction involving a Related Person in which the rates or charges involved are determined by competitive bid
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction with a Related Person involving the rendering of services as a common or contract carrier, or public utility, at rates or charges fixed in conformity with law or governmental authority;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transactions with a Related Person involving services as a bank depository of funds, transfer agent, registrar, trustee under a trust indenture or similar services; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any transaction, contract or arrangement approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Reflects Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed our compensation program to drive performance toward the achievement of our short-term and long-term goals and to increase stockholder value, while appropriately balancing risk and reward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Compensation Committee (for purposes of this Executive Compensation section of the proxy statement, the Committee) conducted its annual review and risk assessment of the Companys compensation policies and practices to ensure our compensation program remains competitive and continues to align individual and group performance with the operational and financial performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this review, the Committee concluded that no significant changes to our compensation program were necessary and that our compensation program was appropriately designed for the size and complexity of the Company and was not reasonably likely to encourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to continue to regularly review our compensation program and incorporate best practices, examples of which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock ownership guidelines

sentences.text: Pay-for-Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail below, our compensation program is focused on aligning the interests of our senior executives with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the majority of total direct compensation is in the form of performance-based variable pay awards (cash bonus awards and long-term incentive equity awards), the aggregate total direct compensation of our senior

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, we held our annual stockholder advisory vote on executive compensation, commonly referred to as a say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of all votes cast, approximately 94% were in favor of the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in our 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered the results of the say-on-pay vote together with the trends in the say-on-pay votes of other companies and concluded that the vote affirms stockholder support of our approach to executive compensation.

sentences.text: The Committee regularly discusses the general principles that form the basis of our compensation program.

sentences.text: Aligning Compensation with Stockholder Interests
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary goal of our compensation program is to align the interests of our senior executives with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The elements utilized to help achieve this alignment include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grants of performance shares, which incentivize management actions that are likely to enhance stockholder return and return on invested capital;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grants of time-vested, non-qualified stock options and awards of time-vested restricted stock units under our long-term incentive plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive stock ownership guidelines pursuant to which senior executives are expected to maintain significant holdings of our stock; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance-based cash bonus awards applicable to all of our named executive officers under which amounts paid out to our named executive officers (if a minimum EPS target is achieved) are determined on a subjective basis, based on a variety of factors, including, with respect to 2016, the percentage payout under the bonus plan applicable to employees below the senior executive level, the individual performance of each named executive officer, and the subjective achievement of certain strategic and operational goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewarding Both Annual and Long-Term Performance, with an Emphasis on Long-Term Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The various components of our compensation program are intended to reward the achievement of both annual and long-term performance, strategic, and operational objectives by the Company, the Companys business units, and individual senior executives, in each case, with a greater emphasis on long-term, sustainable performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This objective, in many ways, overlaps with the alignment objective and is achieved through the same compensation elements, which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grants of performance shares, the payout of which is contingent upon our performance, as measured by certain key financial measures, over a three-year period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grants of stock options and restricted stock units, the values of which are dependent upon the growth of the Companys stock price over a period of several years; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual performance-based cash bonus awards applicable to all of our named executive officers, with a targeted focus on annual individual and Company-wide operational goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing a Pay Opportunity Comparable with Peer Companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our goal to provide opportunities that are generally competitive with the companies with which we compete for talent in order to attract and retain superior employees in key executive positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These opportunities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a competitive total direct compensation package consisting of base salary, performance-based cash bonus awards, and long- term incentive equity awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employment agreements with our senior executives, which contain severance and change in control provisions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an Executive Deferred Compensation Plan, which provides a tax-advantaged method for our senior executives to save for retirement and under which we make contributions that cliff vest after three years (subject to acceleration upon eligibility for retirement  see Other Compensation Related Matters  Deferred Compensation on page 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail below, we do not believe our program encourages excessive or unnecessary risk-taking.

sentences.text: Pursuant to our executive performance-based cash bonus award program, each senior executive, including each of our named executive officers, has an annual target bonus amount expressed as a percentage of the executives base salary  175% for Mr. Wentworth, 100% for Mr. Slusser, 70% for Mr. Sample, 80% for each of Ms. Houston and Mr. Queller, and 150% for Mr. Paz (the effect of any salary adjustments during the year are pro-rated when determining base salary).

sentences.text: The award is granted under our stockholder-approved, long-term incentive plan at 215% of each such senior executives target annual bonus amount, which reflects the maximum potential award.

sentences.text: Key Features
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance shares are settled in shares of our common stock on a share-for-share basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Value of payout depends on the achievement of certain performance measures over a three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance measures are weighted equally and include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-year total stockholder return: The Companys performance with respect to three-year total stockholder return relative to the S&P 100 Index determines the payout with respect to 50% of the total number of performance shares grante based on the following scale, with a result between the various thresholds resulting in a proportionately adjusted payout, provided that achievement below the 30th percentile will trigger a 0% payout:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-Year Total Stockholder Return: Companys Percentile Rank Against  S&P 100 Index   Payment as Percentage of 50% of the Total Number of Performance Shares Granted    Less than 30th Percentile   0%   30th Percentile   50%   50th Percentile   100%   80th Percentile   250%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder return is the annualized rate of return reflecting price appreciation over the performance period plus einvestment of dividends on a monthly basis and the compounding effect of dividends paid on reinvested dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-year average return on invested capital: The Companys performance with respect to three-year average return on invested capital relative to a predetermined target determines the payout with respect to 50% of the total number of performance shares granted based on the following scale, with a result between the various thresholds resulting in a proportionately adjusted payout, provided that a three-year average return on invested capital below 10.50% will trigger a 0% payout:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-Year Average Return on Invested Capital   Payment as Percentage of 50% of the Total Number of Performance Shares Granted    Below 10.50%   0%   10.50%   50%   10.75%   100%   11.25%   250%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on invested capital is income before extraordinary items (available for common stock), divided by total invested capital, which is the sum of total long-term debt, preferred stock, minority interest and total common equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determines the vesting schedule for each time-based equity grant and generally makes grants that vest in equal amounts over approximately three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to relieve administrative burdens inherent with multiple vestings within a short period of time (e.g., calculation of tax withholding amounts, multiple SEC filing requirements, etc.), we generally align the annual vesting date for time-based equity awards to a specific date (as opposed to the anniversary of the actual grant date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, with respect to annual long-term incentive equity awards granted to employees, which are typically granted in late February or early March of each year, we have historically set the annual vesting dates for all awards to February 28.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in the case of retirement, disability or death, certain change in control transactions, or, in the case of performance share awards, termination by the Company without Cause, senior executives generally must be employed by the Company on the scheduled vesting date in order for such vesting to occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate value of a named executive officers long-term incentive equity award is determined by the Committee based, in part, upon the contribution that the named executive officer is expected to make to the overall growth, profitability and financial performance of the Company during the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers long-term incentive equity compensation evels of our Peer Group Companies and the annual competitive market assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company maintains stock ownership guidelines (see Other Compensation Related Matters  Stock Ownership Guidelines on page 39), the Committee does not consider existing stock ownership levels of individual executives in determining the amount of long-term incentive equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Related Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n accordance with our pay-for-performance compensation philosophy, no perquisites were provided to our senior executives in 2016 hat would be required to be reported in this proxy statement, except for the reimbursement of relocation expenses for Messrs. Slusser and Sample as reflected on page 43.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the offices in our headquarters building are the same size, including the offices of our senior executives; no reserved parking is provided to employees at any level; and no financial counseling programs are provided o our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our senior executives pay significantly higher premiums for medical insurance than our lower compensated employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides an opportunity for senior executives to participate in the Executive Deferred Compensation Plan (EDCP), a deferred compensation program that is intended to comply with the rules provided under Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating senior executives can elect to defer up to 50% of their annual base salary and up to 100% of their annual performance-based cash bonus award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have historically made contributions to each senior executives EDCP account in an amount equal to 6% of such senior executives annual cash compensation, with the contributions subject to three-year cliff vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a senior executive becomes eligible for retirement under the EDCP (minimum age of 55 and a combined age plus years of service with the Company of 65), or upon termination due to death or disability (as defined in the EDCP plan), all Company EDCP contributions vest in full.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination for any reason other than death, disability or retirement, all unvested Company EDCP contributions are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the 6% annual contribution to the EDCP and the opportunity to participate in the Companys qualified 401(k) plan, the Company provides no retirement benefits to its senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred compensation provides our senior executives a tax-favored method of accumulating assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year vesting schedule applicable to Company contributions is intended to serve as a retention device for our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts contributed to the EDCP by the participant are deemed to be invested in the hypothetical investment options selected by the participant from a defined set of investment options and a Company stock fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions made by the Company are allocated as follows: 75% of the contribution is allocated to the participants selected hypothetical investment options and 25% is allocated to the Company stock fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The account is credited with the gains or losses of the selected hypothetical investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the EDCP does not credit above-market or preferential earnings on nonqualified deferred compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Withdrawals and distributions of vested amounts are made after termination from the Company, either at a fixed time in a lump sum payment or pursuant to a previously specified fixed schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distribution of a participants EDCP account is made in cash, except for those amounts that are invested in the Company Stock Fund, which are distributed in whole shares of our common stock with fractional shares paid in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All withdrawals and distributions are made in compliance with Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior executives also participate in employee benefit plans generally available to all employees on the same terms as similarly situated employees, including our 401(k) plan and health and welfare plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company offers equivalent health insurance plans to all of our employees, and the employee-paid portions of the premiums on such insurance plans are tiered such that more highly compensated employees pay higher premiums in order to subsidize the premiums for lower paid employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the employee contributions paid by our highest paid employees can be nearly 250% higher than those paid by our lowest paid employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all of our employees, including our senior executives, are eligible to receive up to a $2,000 contribution to a Health Savings Account, subject to enrollment in our health insurance plan available to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has approved and adopted a formal clawback policy that is applicable to all current and former senior executives who receive incentive-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides, subject to Committee discretion, for the recovery of incentive-based compensation in the event of a restatement of financial results, regardless of whether misconduct was the cause of the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy became effective beginning with fiscal year 2012 reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If additional clawback rules are approved by the SEC, we intend to review our policy and compensation plans and amend them, as necessary, to comply with the new mandates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special Bonuses and Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, we may grant one-time discretionary cash bonuses or equity awards for new hires, retention, promotion and special recognition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses such bonuses and equity awards to attract, motivate, reward, and retain key executives when appropriate to promote the overall long-term success of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the factors that the Committee considers when granting sign-on bonuses and equity awards is the extent to which such executives would forfeit their unvested compensation as a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: result of leaving their previous employers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed beginning on page 48, we have entered into employment agreements with our CEO and each of our other senior executives, which provide for, among other things, severance benefits and change in control protections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that these agreements are appropriate and provide value to the Company for a number of reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the agreements assist in attracting and retaining senior executives as we compete for talented employees in a marketplace where such agreements are commonly offered;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the severance provisions require terminated senior executives to execute a release in favor of the Company in order to receive any severance payments and such payments are further conditioned upon compliance with certain terms of the agreement, including covenants with respect to non-competition, non-solicitation and non-disparagement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the change in control protections and severance benefits help to retain key personnel during rumored or actual acquisitions or similar corporate changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreement with Mr. Wentworth runs through March 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements with our other senior executives are automatically renewed on April 1 of each year for successive one-year periods unless either party provides notice of non-renewal at least 90 days prior to the end of the term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A goal of our executive compensation program is to preserve the deductibility of compensation through compliance with the requirements of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code), to the extent deemed practicable or appropriate by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) places a limit of $1 million on the amount of compensation that a publicly-traded company may deduct in any one year for any of its named executive officers (as defined in the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does not apply to performance-based compensation meeting certain requirements (including the requirement that such compensation be paid under a stockholder-approved plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the stock option, performance share and performance-based cash bonus awards were designed with the intention of satisfying the deductibility requirements of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we cannot guarantee that our awards will in fact satisfy such requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains guidelines for stock ownership with respect to its senior executives and vice presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the guidelines is to encourage our senior executives and vice presidents to show a commitment to the Company and its stockholders by holding a prescribed number of shares of Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to shares of Company stock, the following equity vehicles (in each case assuming shares are withheld for taxes) are included when determining compliance with the ownership guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unvested restricted stock units, net of taxes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company share equivalents held under the EDCP, net of taxes; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: vested, unexercised stock options, net of taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested performance shares and unvested stock options are not included in determining compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the guidelines are not mandatory, compliance is reviewed annually by the Committee and communicated to the senior executives and vice presidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each senior executive and vice president has five years from the time of becoming a senior executive or vice president to attain the recommended ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines provide that each senior executive or vice president hold a number of eligible shares with a value at least equal to a multiple of his or her base annual salary as follows: 6.0x for the CEO, 4.0x for the President, 3.0x for all Executive Vice Presidents, 2.5x for all Senior Vice Presidents, and 1.0x-1.5x for our Vice Presidents, with an exception for cases where the guidelines are not met due to a significant decrease in the stock price, in which case, the guidelines provide a period of two years to remedy the shortfall.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, each of our named executive officers was in compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Award Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By granting annual long-term incentive equity awards during the first quarter, the Committee is able to consider the previous years financial performance in determining the size and structure of such awards, both in the aggregate and with respect to individual senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, by granting such awards during the first quarter, the Committee is able to coordinate such grants with the payout of performance-based cash bonus awards and annual base salary adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has an equity award policy, which covers grant approvals and the establishment of the grant date for equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to this policy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual long-term incentive equity awards granted to our named executive officers during the first quarter of each year have an effective grant date as of the last to occur of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the date of the final action necessary by the Committee or the Board (as appropriate) to approve such award;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) such later date as may be specified in the terms of such award; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) if the effective date under
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) above would not fall within an open window trading period, then such award will be granted with an effective grant date as of the third trading date following the date of the next release of quarterly or annual financial results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: special equity awards for new hires, retention, promotion and special recognition may be granted during an open window trading period or, if the Committee, the Board or the CEO (as appropriate) acts outside of such a period, then such award will be granted with an effective grant date as of the third trading date following the date of the next release of quarterly or annual financial results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the exercise price of stock options will not be less than the closing trading price of the stock on the grant date; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: equity grants with a prospective grant date will be made on a nominal value basis consistent with the method the Company uses to value options for financial reporting purposes under applicable authoritative accounting guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout this proxy statement, we refer to the grant date as the date of issuance of a long-term incentive equity award to a grantee, which, pursuant to the equity award policy discussed above, may be later than the date such award was approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivatives Trading and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because a primary goal of our equity-based incentive compensation program is to align the interests of our senior executives with those of our stockholders, we prohibit the trading of derivative securities related to shares of our stock, including hedging strategies, puts, calls or other types of derivative securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our derivatives policy also prohibits pledging shares of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assessment of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not believe that our compensation program, including the executive compensation program, encourages excessive or inappropriate risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of our executive compensation program is performance-based, and, while appropriate risk-taking is a necessary component of growing a business, the Committee and management have focused on aligning our compensation policies with our long-term interests and avoiding short-term rewards that could incentivize actions with undue long- term risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples of such features of our compensation program include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Annual Performance-Based Cash Bonus Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of our named executive officers is not overly- weighted toward short-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For instance, Mr. Wentworths target performance-based cash bonus award for 2016 was approximately 14% of his total target direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based cash bonus awards with respect to each senior executive are also capped at 215% of such senior executives target bonus award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasis on Long-Term Incentive Equity Awards; Overlapping Vesting Periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The largest percentage of total target direct compensation for our named executive officers is provided through long-term incentive equity compensation, which vests over a period of years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vesting period encourages our senior executives to focus on sustaining and enhancing our Companys long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentive equity awards are also made annually so that our senior executives always have unvested equity awards that could significantly decrease in value if our business is not appropriately managed for the long- term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of the long-term incentive equity compensation of our named executive officers consists of performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share payouts are tied to the achievement of certain performance measures, which encourages focus on sustaining our long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards also have overlapping performance periods, so that any risks taken to increase the payout under one award could jeopardize the potential payout under other awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further reduce the incentive for unnecessary risk-taking, we cap the payout of these awards at 250% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of awards are made based on the achievement of a variety of performance measures, both predetermined (return on invested capital and EPS) and relative to the S&P 100 index (total stockholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return), which diversifies the risks associated with any single indicator of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these measures are affected by management decisions and correlate to the creation of stockholder value over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 40    EXPRESS SCRIPTS HOLDING COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Committee approve the final payout of the annual performance-based cash bonus awards for our named executive officers following a review of executive and Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final payouts are ratified by the Board in the case of our Executive Vice Presidents and by the independent members of the Board in the case of our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the Companys compensation and incentive plans available to employees other than our named executive officers to, among other things, prevent unnecessary risk taking under such plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines require our senior executives and vice presidents to hold a certain amount of Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This requirement ensures that each senior executive and vice president will have a significant amount of personal wealth tied to the long-term performance of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a clawback policy applicable to all current and former senior executives (including the Chief Accounting Officer) who receive incentive-based compensation following the effectiveness of the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides, subject to Committee discretion, for the recovery of incentive-based compensation in the event of a restatement of financial results, regardless of whether misconduct was the cause of the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In summary, we have structured our compensation program so that a considerable amount of the wealth of our senior executives is tied to the long-term health and performance of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to provide incentives for our senior executives to manage for long-term performance while safeguarding our stockholders from inappropriate incentive-based compensation payments in the event of financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also seek to avoid the type of disproportionately large short-term incentives that could encourage senior executives to take risks that may not be in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this combination of factors encourages our senior executives to manage our Company in a prudent manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2000 LTIP and the award agreements under the 2011 LTIP and 2016 LTIP, pursuant to which the awards reflected in this table were granted, generally define comparable employment as employment with us or our successor following a change in control pursuant to which:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the responsibilities and duties of the named executive officer are substantially the same as before the change in control, and the other terms and conditions of employment following the change in control do not impose obligations materially more burdensome;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the aggregate compensation is substantially economically equivalent to or greater than the named executive officer aggregate compensation immediately prior to the change in control; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the named executive officer remains employed in the metropolitan area in which he or she was employed immediately preceding the change in control (or, with respect to certain grants, the principal place of employment is not relocated more tha fifty miles).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Terms of Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following provides a summary of the benefits provided to our named executive officers as of December 31, 2016 under the employment agreements and the form of grant notices for long-term incentive equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where benefits are subject to approval by the Committee, such benefits are also ratified by the Board in the case of our Executive Vice Presidents and by the independent members of the Board in the case of our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits and payments set forth below are generally subject to adjustment and deferral as necessary to comply with Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 8, 2017, we executed amended and restated employment agreements with each of our named executive officers (other than Mr. Wentworth and Mr. Paz) which eliminated the concept of early retirement and revised the definition of tenured retirement, in each case, as discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the agreements generally provides for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the payment of an annual base salary (which may not be reduced after any increase);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a minimum target performance-based cash bonus award as a fixed percentage of the named executive officers base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the right to receive restricted stock unit awards, stock option awards and other equity awards and deferred compensation, to the extent determined by the Committee and the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) participation in our other employee benefit plans on the same basis as such plans are generally made available to our other senior executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) the reimbursement of reasonable business expenses incurred in performing the named executive officers duties; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) such perquisites and fringe benefits to which our other senior executives are entitled and which are suitable for the named executive officers position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Termination of Employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each agreement provides for the provision and forfeiture of certain benefits if the named executive officers employment is terminated for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, if the named executive officers employment is terminated at any time, the named executive officer is entitled to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) all previously earned and accrued, but unpaid, base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reimbursement for any business expenses properly incurred prior to termination; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) such other employee benefits (if any) to which the named executive officer may be entitled under our employee benefit plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than as set forth below, if the named executive officers employment is terminated,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) all unvested stock options are forfeited and all vested stock options remain exercisable for the one-year period following the date of termination, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) all unvested restricted stock units and performance shares are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment is terminated by the Company for cause, all vested stock options are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits set forth below with respect to equity awards apply only to equity awards granted after the effective date of an employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Termination by the Company Other Than for Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment is terminated by us other than for cause, the named executive officer is entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cash Bonus Termination Benefit:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any performance-based cash bonus award earned for a previously completed performance year but unpaid as of the termination date, payable solely to the extent approved by the Committee; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an amount equal to the performance-based cash bonus award the named executive officer would have been entitled to receive for the year in which the termination occurs had the named executive officer remained employed through the end of such year, which amount shall be pro-rated for the portion of the termination year during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company and is payable in a lump sum at the same time performance-based cash bonus awards are paid out to other senior executives and payable solely to the extent approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Benefit: A severance benefit equal to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 18 months of base salary plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 150% of the named executive officers target performance-based cash bonus award for the year in which the termination date occurs, payable in 18 substantially equal monthly installments beginning the first full month after termination, subject to a six-month deferral if necessary to avoid certain adverse tax consequences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
