sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Healthcare Termination Benefit: Reimbursement for the cost of continuing medical insurance under COBRA for a period of 18 months after termination (for Mr. Wentworth, payments for 36 months equal to either the cost of continuing medical insurance under COBRA or, following expiration of the COBRA period, equivalent medical insurance coverage).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Mr. Wentworth, following the cessation of the 36 month coverage and subject to certain conditions, Mr. Wentworth may pay the full cost to continue participating in the retiree medical plan through age 65; and if the retiree medical plan is no longer offered, the Company will use commercially reasonable efforts to assist Mr. Wentworth in purchasing medical coverage that is reasonably equivalent to the medical benefits provided to current employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rights with respect to medical benefits transfer to the spouse at the time of death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For performance share awards, the named executive officer vests in a number of unvested performance shares equal to the lesser of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number of performance shares which would have vested and been paid based on the actual achievement of the performance measures at the end of the performance period, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the number of performance shares which would have vested and been paid based on an assumed performance period ending as of the most recently completed fiscal quarter prior to termination, in either case, pro-rated for the portion of the performance period during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Termination by the Named Executive Officer for Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officer terminates employment with us for good reason, the named executive officer is entitled to the benefits set forth under Benefits Upon Termination by the Company Other Than for Cause above, except all unvested and unpaid performance shares are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Termination on Account of Death or Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment terminates on account of death or disability, the named executive officer or his or her estate, as applicable, is generally entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cash Bonus Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Healthcare Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All unvested stock options vest and become exercisable in full, and together with all vested stock options may be exercised at any time, or from time to time, within one year after the date of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A pro-rated portion of unvested restricted stock units vest, pro-rated for the portion of the vesting period during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officer vests in a number of unvested performance shares to the extent the performance criteria are ultimately achieved and any payment of performance shares is pro-rated for the portion of the performance period during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Company EDCP contributions to the named executive officers EDCP account are accelerated and vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Non-Renewal of the Employment Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If either party elects not to renew the agreement at the end of any employment period, the agreement and benefits thereunder will terminate, and the further employment of the named executive officer will be at-will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the Company elects not to renew the agreement at the end of any employment period, and the named executive officer resigns, the named executive officer is entitled to the benefits set forth under Benefits Upon Termination by the Named Executive Officer for Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Tenured Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment terminates on account of a tenured retirement (59.5 years of age and 4.5 years of service as a senior executive), the named executive officer is generally entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cash Bonus Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Healthcare Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All vested stock options remain vested and exercisable through the end of their term and all unvested stock options continue to vest in accordance with their term as if the named executive officer was still employed by the Company and remain vested and exercisable through the end of their term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All unvested restricted stock units continue to vest in accordance with their term as if the named executive officer was still employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officer vests in a number of unvested performance shares to the extent that the performance criteria are ultimately achieved; provided, however, that if the named executive officers termination date occurs prior to the third calendar month of the final year of the applicable performance period, the number of performance shares eligible for a payout greater than 100% of target with respect to such performance period is limited to a pro-rated number of performance shares based on the portion of the performance period during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company and the remaining performance shares are subject to a maximum payout equal to 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 8, 2017, we executed amended and restated employment agreements with each of our named executive officers (other than Mr. Wentworth and Mr. Paz) which revised the definition of tenured retirement as follows: 55 years of age; 3 years of service as a senior executive; and a minimum sum of age and years of service with the Company equal to 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Upon Early Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment terminates on account of early retirement (54.5 years of age, 4.5 years of service as a senior executive and the sum of the named executive officers age and cumulative years of service as a senior executive equal at least 64 years), the named executive officer is generally entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cash Bonus Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Healthcare Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to stock options granted prior to January 1, 2014, vested stock options remain vested and exercisable until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the end of their term and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 12 months from the date of retirement plus the number of months employed by the Company past age 55 (the early retirement extension period); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to stock options granted after January 1, 2014:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested awards remain vested and exercisable until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the end of their term and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) four years following the date of retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested stock options that are scheduled to vest prior to the early retirement option expiration date (four years following the date of retirement) vest on schedule, pro-rated based on the number of months employed by the Company past age 55 divided by 60 and remain vested and exercisable through the early retirement option expiration date; unvested stock options scheduled to vest following the early retirement option expiration date are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A pro-rated portion of restricted stock units (based on the number of months employed by the Company past age 55, divided by 60) that are scheduled to vest on or prior to the third anniversary of the retirement date shall continue to vest in accordance with their terms as if the named executive officer was still employed by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested performance shares vest, pro-rated based on the number of months employed by the Company past age 55, divided by 60, and such vested performance shares are only paid out to the extent the performance measures are ultimately achieved; provided, however, that if the named executive officers termination date occurs prior to the third calendar month of the final year of the applicable performance period, the number of performance shares eligible for a payout greater than 100% of target with respect to such performance period is limited to a pro-rated number of performance shares based on the portion of the performance period during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company and the remaining performance shares are subject to a maximum payout equal to 100% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On March 8, 2017, we executed amended and restated employment agreements with each of our named executive officers (other than Mr. Wentworth and Mr. Paz) which eliminated the concept of early retirement.

sentences.text: Benefits Upon a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, prior to, concurrent with or following a change in control, the named executive officers employment is terminated by the Company without cause or following a change in control the named executive officer terminates employment with Company for good reason, then the named executive officer is generally entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any performance-based cash bonus award earned for a previously completed performance year but unpaid as of the termination date, payable solely to the extent approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An amount equal to the named executive officers target performance-based cash bonus award for the year in which the termination occurs, which amount shall be pro-rated for the portion of the termination year during which the named executive officer was employed by the Company and is payable in a lump sum within sixty days following the termination date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A severance benefit equal to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 24 months of base salary plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 200% of the named executive officers target performance-based cash bonus award for the year in which the termination date occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance benefit is payable in 24 substantially equal monthly installments beginning the first full month after termination, subject to a six-month deferral if necessary to avoid certain adverse tax consequences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Healthcare Termination Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) within 90 days prior to the change in control date the employment of the named executive officer is terminated without cause, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) within two years following the change in control date, the employment of the named executive officer is terminated without cause or the named executive officer terminates employment due to a constructive termination, then all outstanding unvested options shall vest in full on the change in control date, in the case of clause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) above, or as of the date of termination, in the case of clause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) above, and remain exercisable for the duration of their term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if following the change in control date there will be no generally recognized U.S. public market for the Companys common stock or any common stock for which the Companys common stock is exchanged, then on the change in control date all unvested stock options shall vest and become fully exercisable and each stock option shall be cancelled and the Company shall provide payment in connection with such cancellation at a purchase price equal to the excess (if any) of the per share change in control purchase price over the exercise price of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If following the change in control date there will be a generally recognized U.S. public market for the Companys common stock or any common stock for which the Companys common stock is exchanged, then all stock options shall be assumed, exchanged or substituted for by a successor or acquirer entity and shall be subject to the same terms and conditions that were applicable to the stock options prior to the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) within 90 days prior to the change in control date the employment of the named executive officer is terminated without cause, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) above, or as of the date of termination, in the case of clause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If following the change in control date there will be no generally recognized U.S. public market for the Companys common stock or any common stock for which the Companys common stock is exchanged, then as of the change in control date, the Company shall pay into a rabbi trust, in respect of each cancelled restricted stock unit, a purchase price equal to the per share change in control purchase price and all restricted stock units shall be cancelled, and such per share amount shall be disbursed on the date on which the respective cancelled restricted stock unit would have vested, either according to its original schedule or upon acceleration, as applicable.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to performance shares, if the named executive officer is employed by the Company on the change in control date, then the named executive officer shall receive in cash, within 10 days following the change in control date, the value of one share of the Companys common stock as of the last trading day before the change in control date, multiplied by the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the target grant with respect to each performance share award and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the named executive officers employment has been terminated by the Company without cause prior to the change in control date, then the named executive officer shall receive in cash, within 10 days following the change in control date, the value of one share of the Companys common stock as of the last trading day before the change in control date, multiplied by the lesser of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, at its discretion, may provide for different treatment of performance share awards that are not assumed, exchanged or substituted or are otherwise cancelled in connection with a change in control.

sentences.text: Restrictive Covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment, each named executive officer is prohibited from
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) soliciting certain clients or prospective clients of the Company for a period of two years after termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) soliciting or hiring employees of the Company for a period of two years after termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) competing with the Company for a period of eighteen months after termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) disparaging the Company or its officers, directors and employees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) disclosing certain confidential information with respect to the Company or its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, following a termination, the named executive officer violates any of these covenants, then the named executive officer will forfeit all termination benefits provided under the executive employment agreement, and will be required to reimburse the Company for any realized benefits resulting from termination.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our directors and executive officers, persons who beneficially own more than ten percent of a registered class of our equity securities, and certain other persons to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership on Forms 3, 4 and 5 with the SEC and to furnish the Company with copies of the forms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely on our review of the forms we received or that were filed with the SEC, or written representations from reporting persons, we believe that all of our directors, executive officers and any greater than ten percent beneficial owners complied with all such filing requirements during 2016, except that due to an internal administrative error, Everett Neville, Senior Vice President, Supply Chain and Specialty, filed a Form 4 on March 15, 2017 reporting late two acquisitions in 2015 and 2016 of an aggregate 61.218 phantom shares in the Company stock fund of the EDCP, for which Form 4 filings were not timely made.

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee is composed of four directors who, in the judgment of our Board, meet the independence requirements of The Nasdaq Global Select Market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1992, the Audit Committee has operated under a charter adopted by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter, as amended, can be found at the Investor Relations  Governance  Corporate Governance Documents section of our website at www.express-scripts.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary function of the Audit Committee is to assist our Board in its oversight of the integrity of our Companys financial reporting processes and system of internal controls with respect to finance and accounting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for our financial statements and overall reporting process, including the system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accountants are responsible for conducting annual audits and quarterly reviews of our financial statements and expressing opinions on the conformity of the Companys audited financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles and on the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee submits the following report pursuant to SEC rules:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the audited consolidated financial statements of Express Scripts Holding Company included in the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 (which we refer to as the Financial Statements).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, our Companys independent registered public accountants, the matters required to be discussed by Auditing Standard No. 16, as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board, or PCAOB.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received from PwC the written disclosures and the letters required by the applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence (which relates to the auditors independence from our Company and its related entities), and has discussed with PwC the independence of PwC from us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the aforementioned review and discussions, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board that the Financial Statements be included in the Express Scripts Holding Company Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Respectfully submitted,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frank Mergenthaler, Chair William J. DeLaney Nicholas J. LaHowchic Seymour Sternberg
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Report of the Audit Committee will not be deemed incorporated by reference by any general statement incorporating by reference this proxy statement or portions thereof into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, except to the extent that we specifically incorporate this information by reference, and will not otherwise be deemed filed under such Acts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY ITEM NO. 2: RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The firm of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP served as our independent registered public accountants for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board has appointed PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP to act in that capacity for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is expected to be present at the annual meeting, will have the opportunity to make a statement, and will be available to respond to appropriate questions from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we are not required to submit this appointment to a stockholder vote, the Audit Committee believes that it is appropriate as a matter of policy to request that our stockholders ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our principal ndependent registered public accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the stockholders do not ratify the appointment, the Audit Committee will investigate the reasons for stockholder rejection and consider whether to retain PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP or appoint another auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the appointment is ratified, the Audit Committee in its discretion may direct the appointment of a different independent auditor at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the best interests of the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Accountant Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table presents fees for professional services rendered by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for the audit with respect to our annual financial statements for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2016, as well as fees billed for other services rendered by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP during those periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Audit fees are fees paid for professional services rendered for the audit of our annual consolidated financial statements, for reviews of our interim consolidated financial statements and SEC filings, and for the audit of internal controls over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit fees also include fees for work generally only the independent auditor can be expected to provide, such as services associated with documents filed with the SEC and with assistance in responding to SEC comment letters, as well as reports, specific audits and agreed upon procedures as required by regulators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Audit related fees are fees paid for assurance and related services performed by our independent registered public accountant, including services related to SOC 1 reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Tax fees are fees paid for state tax apportionment work, preparation and review of international tax filings, and international tax consulting and advice related to compliance with international tax laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) All other fees include any fees earned for services rendered by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP during 2015 and 2016 that are not included in any of the above categories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other fees for 2015 and 2016 consist of licensing fees paid by us with respect to certain accounting research software.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee charter requires the Audit Committees pre-approval of all services, both audit and permitted non-audit, to be performed for the Company by the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether proposed services are permissible, the Audit Committee considers whether the provision of such services is compatible with maintaining auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its consideration of proposed services, the Audit Committee may
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) consult with management as part of the decision-making process, but may not delegate this authority to management and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) delegate, from time to time, its authority to pre-approve such services to one or more Audit Committee members, provided that any such approvals are presented to the full Audit Committee at the next scheduled Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends a vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accountants for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY ITEM NO. 3: NON-BINDING VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act requires that we include in this proxy statement a non-binding stockholder vote on our executive compensation as described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage stockholders to review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, or CD&A, beginning on page 26.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CD&A provides additional details of our executive compensation program, including our compensation philosophy and objectives, the individual elements of our executive compensation program, and how our executive compensation program is administered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the executive compensation as disclosed in the CD&A, tabular disclosures, and other narrative executive compensation disclosures in this proxy statement aligns with our compensation philosophy and objectives as well as the pay practices of our Peer Group Companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board strongly endorses the Companys executive compensation program and recommends that stockholders vote in favor of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders approve the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and the tabular and narrative disclosures included in the Companys 2017 annual meeting proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is advisory and non-binding, the Board values the opinions of the Companys stockholders as expressed through their votes and other communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee will consider the outcome of the advisory vote on executive compensation when making future compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently intend to hold a non-binding stockholder vote on our executive compensation each year at the annual meeting of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board   The Board unanimously recommends a vote FOR the approval of the above resolution and the Companys executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY ITEM NO. 4: NON-BINDING VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the requirements of Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are providing stockholders with the opportunity to vote, on a non-binding basis, on whether the advisory vote on executive compensation (Proxy Item No. 3 above) should occur every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that the advisory vote on executive compensation should occur every one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has held annual votes for the past six years, and our Board believes that the annual vote provides our stockholders the opportunity to provide prompt feedback regarding our executive compensation program and allows the Board and the Compensation Committee to evaluate individual compensation decisions each year in light of feedback from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is advisory and non-binding, the Board values the opinions of the Companys stockholders as expressed through their votes and other communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee will consider the outcome of the advisory vote on executive compensation when considering whether to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation every one, two or three years.

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends a vote to hold non-binding votes on executive compensation  EVERY ONE YEAR.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder proposal requesting the Board adopt a policy and amend the Companys governance documents, as necessary, to require the Chairman of the Board, whenever possible, to be an independent member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5  Independent Board Chairman
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: Shareholders request our Board of Directors to adopt as policy, and amend our governing documents as necessary, to require the Chair of the Board of Directors, whenever possible, to be an independent member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board determines that a Chair who was independent when selected is no longer independent, the Board shall select a new Chair who satisfies the requirements of the policy within a reasonable amount of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with this policy is waived if no independent director is available and willing to serve as Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board would have the discretion to phase in this policy for the next CEO transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the responsibility of the Board of Directors to protect shareholders long-term interests by providing independent oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A board chairman who is independent of the Company and its management will promote greater management accountability to shareholders and lead to a more objective evaluation of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Intels former chair Andrew Grove stated, The separation of the two jobs goes to the heart of the conception of a corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is a company a sandbox for the CEO, or is the CEO an employee?

sentences.text: If hes an employee, he needs a boss, and that boss is the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman runs the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can the CEO be his own boss?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the Millstein Center for Corporate Governance and Performance (Yale), The independent chair curbs conflicts of interest, promotes oversight of risk, manages the relationship between the board and CEO, serves as a conduit for regular communication with shareowners, and is a logical next step in the development of an independent board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An NACD Blue Ribbon Commission on Directors Professionalism recommended that an independent director should be charged with organizing the boards evaluation of the CEO and provide ongoing feedback; chairing executive sessions of the board; setting the agenda and leading the board in anticipating and responding to crises.

sentences.text: A number of prominent institutional investors publicly advocate for strong board leadership to best provide necessary oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The California Public Employees Retirement Systems Global Principles of Accountable Corporate Governance recommends that a companys board should be chaired by an independent director, as does the Council of Institutional Investors.

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal for the reasons set forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Corporate Governance Committee have considered this proposal and concluded that its adoption is unnecessary and is not in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the proposal, the Board also considered votes on similar proposals by our stockholders in 2015 and 2016, which were each rejected by a majority of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board considered the retirement of George Paz as our CEO and the resulting separation of the offices of Chairman of the Board and CEO in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board values the flexibility of selecting, on a case-by-case basis, the style of leadership best suited to meet the needs of Express Scripts and its stockholders based on the individuals available and circumstances as they exist at the time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption of a mandate that the Chairman of the Board be an independent director would limit the Boards ability to select the director best suited to serve as Chairman based on the relevant facts, circumstances, and criteria as they exist at the time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such a mandate would impose an unnecessary restriction on the Board that is not in the best interests of Express Scripts or its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is essential that the Board maintain an appropriate degree of discretion to select the best possible Chairman of the Board, including whether Express Scripts and its stockholders are best served by a Chairman who formerly served as CEO or acts in a dual role as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the stated preference of the Board that, upon a transition of the CEO, the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO should generally be split until such time as the Board determines otherwise based on the best interests of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines, available on our website and discussed in greater detail in the Corporate Governance section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines state the Boards preference that the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO should generally be separated upon a transition of the role of CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon Mr. Pazs retirement as CEO following the 2016 annual meeting, the roles of CEO and Chairman of the Board were separated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the proposed inflexible mandate of the stockholder proposal, the preference set forth in the Corporate Governance Guidelines does not limit the Boards discretion to act in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders by selecting the best possible Chairman of the Board based on the relevant facts, circumstances and criteria as they exist at the time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this approach provides the necessary flexibility in determining the Companys Board governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines mandate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a strong Lead Independent Director when the Chairman of the Board is not independent,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority independent Board, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) fully independent key committees, each of which ensures the Board will remain focused on stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines and other governing documents, including our committee charters, include a multitude of provisions to ensure that we conduct our business in accordance with the highest governance standards and with the purpose of enhancing stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an accountable Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Board members is subject to re-election by stockholders annually, and is subject to a majority voting policy as set forth in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a strong Lead Independent Director when our Chairman is not independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When our Chairman of the Board is not independent, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide for a Lead Independent Director who is elected annually by the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Independent Director is an independent director who is involved in all significant corporate decisions, including decisions regarding strategic direction, executive leadership, and governance matters, and among other duties:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presides at all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serves as a liaison between the Chairman of the Board and the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has the authority to approve the nature and extent of information and data sent to the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has the authority to approve meeting agendas for the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has the authority to approve the meeting schedules to assure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has the authority to call meetings of the independent directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if requested by major stockholders, ensures that he or she is available for consultation and direct communication with such stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Lead Independent Director role has been and will continue to be an effective means for strengthening our corporate governance process, empowering our independent directors and enhancing the overall functioning of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mac Mahon currently serves as the Lead Independent Director of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is composed predominately of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Board is composed almost entirely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All but one of the current Board members and nominees are non-employees and all but two of the current Board members and nominees are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors are active participants in the Board process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors meet regularly in executive sessions without members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is an equal participant in the major strategic and policy decisions of Express Scripts and the Chairman of the Board has no greater vote on matters considered by the Board than any other director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Lead Independent Director and the other independent directors communicate regularly with the Chairman of the Board regarding appropriate agenda topics and other related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director may recommend agenda items, and is free to raise any subjects that are not on the agenda for a particular meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, all directors are bound by fiduciary obligations to act in a manner they believe to be in the best interests of Express Scripts and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These duties are not augmented or altered by the separation or combination of the roles of Chairman of the Board and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, the Lead Independent Director is involved in all significant corporate decisions, including decisions regarding strategic direction, executive leadership, and governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key committees are composed entirely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the standing committees (Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Compliance Committee and Corporate Governance Committee) is composed entirely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of each committee, in consultation with the appropriate members of management, develops and approves meeting agendas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director who is a member of a committee may recommend agenda items, and is free to raise any subjects that are not on the agenda for a particular meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, each committee is empowered to investigate any matter of interest or concern that may fall within its authority and retain its own outside counsel and other advisors as it determines appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors meet regularly and generally meet in executive session at every regularly scheduled Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Independent Director regularly chairs executive sessions of our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each independent director may submit topics he or she deems appropriate for discussion at executive sessions to the Lead Independent Director in order to ensure that the interests and needs of the independent directors are appropriately addressed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Independent Director also has the authority to call meetings of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO compensation is determined by independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing the performance of the CEO and for recommending the compensation, including salary, annual incentive compensation and long-term incentive compensation, of the CEO and Express Scripts other senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final compensation decisions with respect to the CEO are considered and approved by the independent members of the Board in executive session, during which the CEO and members of management are not present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is focused on Express Scripts corporate governance practices and will continue to reevaluate its policies on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past decade, the Board has taken actions to enhance its commitment to corporate governance, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adopting a proxy access bylaw allowing stockholders to nominate Board candidates for inclusion in our companys proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommending an amendment to our bylaws (which was approved by our stockholders) to provide stockholders the ability to call a special meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adopting a clawback policy applicable to all current and former executive officers and certain other executive officers, designed to recover incentive compensation in the event of a restatement of financial results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amending our bylaws to adopt majority voting in uncontested elections;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amending our bylaws to reduce the threshold for stockholders to amend our bylaws from two thirds to a majority of the voting power of the outstanding stock entitled to vote thereon;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: enhancing the power and role of the Lead Independent Director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amending the corporate governance principles to provide that the positions of Chairman of the Board and CEO should generally be separated following a transition of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Express Scripts Board reflects a combination of both long-serving and more recent directors who each contribute to Board continuity, while maintaining an appropriate level of oversight with respect to senior management and the CEO and allowing for the inflow of new ideas and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2010, five new independent directors have been added to the Board (four of whom continue to serve on the Board) and seven of our current independent directors were appointed before Mr. Wentworth, our CEO, joined the Company in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will continue to reexamine its policies on an ongoing basis to ensure that its Corporate Governance Guidelines and processes sufficiently serve the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensuring flexibility by not mandating the Chairman of the Board be independent is consistent with the practices of many other Fortune 100 and S&P 500 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reported in the Spencer Stuart 2016 Board Index, published by Spencer Stuart and available at www.spencerstuart.com, only 27% of all S&P 500 companies have an independent Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Express Scripts believes that the stockholder proposal advocating for an independent Chairman policy is not based on experience or evidence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our experience demonstrates that a non-independent Chairman can be the best approach under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The empirical studies sometimes cited in support of an independent Chairman policy are refuted by others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Companys knowledge, no empirical study supports the argument that a policy requiring the Chairman to be independent inherently leads to better performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board should have the flexibility to maintain combined Chairman and CEO roles, or permit the Chairman to be a former CEO or non-independent director for some other reason, when deemed to be in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent voting results on independent Chairman proposals generally support the Companys view that a strict independent Chairman policy is not advisable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to Georgesons 2016 Annual Corporate Governance Review, similar proposals were opposed on average by 69% of stockholders casting votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board unanimously recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal, and your proxy will be so voted if the proposal is presented unless you specify otherwise.

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders request that Express Scripts Holding Company report annually to the board and shareholders, identifying whether there exists a gender pay gap among the companys employees, and if so, the measures being taken (policies, programs, goals etc.) to eliminate any such pay disparities and to facilitate an environment that promotes opportunities for equal advancement or women.

sentences.text: The gender pay gap is defined as the difference between male and female earnings expressed as a percentage of male earnings according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

sentences.text: The report should be prepared by December 2017 at reasonable cost and omit proprietary information.

sentences.text: Women earn about 78 cents for every dollar earned by their male peers.

sentences.text: Differences in age, education, years of experience etc. may explain some of this difference.

sentences.text: However, a study by Glassdoor (Demystifying the Gender Pay Gap) of over 500,000 self-reported salary data points on its website shows that even after adjusting for these factors, there is an unexplained, statistically significant pay gap of 5.4% (the adjusted gender pay gap) between men and women in the US.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The study also revealed that the healthcare and insurance industries both have an adjusted gender pay gap of 7.2% - the largest of 25 industries studied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that women earn about 93 cents for every dollar earned by men working in the same job title, same company, and with similar background and experience,

sentences.text: Human Rights Campaign  Received a Corporate Equality Score of 100% on the 2017 Corporate Equality Index (http://hrc-assets.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com//files/assets/resources/CEI-2017-FinalReport.pdf)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Express Scripts, diversity goes beyond race and gender.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, we launched six Employee Resource Groups (ERG) that offer employees the opportunity to network, enhance personal development, contribute to a diverse and inclusive work environment, and give back to the community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each ERG has a unique focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, one ERG is Women of Express Scripts Listen, Engage, Advocate and Develop (WE LEAD), which focuses on promoting the diversity of women, and creating an environment for professional and personal growth for women in our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, over 3,400 employees, 72% of which were women, participated in one or more of our ERGs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information on WE LEAD and our other ERGs can be found at http://lab.express-scripts.com/about/corporate-citizenship/diversity-and-inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our commitment to diversity and equality, the compensation programs at Express Scripts are designed to prevent gender pay differences and reduce the risks identified in the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally determine compensation based on factors such as scope of job, complexity, required knowledge, skills, and abilities, and internal value of the job to our Company, without any disparate treatment based on the gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, or disability of the person holding the job.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also compare the compensation for any given job with market data based on multiple, nationally recognized salary surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This facilitates consistency of compensation among employees with similar performance who are in jobs of similar scope and complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are proud of our strong commitment to diversity and equality and believe our compensation practices appropriately address the needs of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not believe the resources required to develop a gender pay gap report justifies the stockholder expense of further proving our already established commitment to diversity and equality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board unanimously recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal, and your proxy will be so voted if the proposal is presented unless you specify otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals and Nominations Not for Inclusion in Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our bylaws, a stockholder who, at any annual meeting of our stockholders, intends to nominate a person for election as a director or present a proposal must so notify our Corporate Secretary, in writing, describing such nominee(s) or proposal and providing information concerning such stockholder and the underlying beneficial owner, if any, including, among other things, name, address, occupation, number of shares held, rights to acquire shares and other derivative securities, and any relevant understandings or arrangements between the stockholder and beneficial owner, if any, and the reasons for and interest of such stockholder and beneficial owner, if any, in the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, to be timely, such notice must be received by our Corporate Secretary at our principal executive offices not less than 90 days nor more than 120 days in advance of the first anniversary of the preceding years annual meeting, provided that in the event that no annual meeting was held the previous year or the date of the annual meeting has been changed by more than 30 days from the date of the previous years meeting, or in the event of a special meeting of stockholders called to elect directors, not later than the close of business on the tenth day following the day on which notice of the date of the meeting was mailed or public disclosure of the date of the meeting was made, whichever occurs first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our annual meeting to be held in 2018, any such notice must be received by us at our principal executive offices between January 11, 2018 and February 10, 2018 to be considered timely for purposes of the 2018 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any person interested in offering such a nomination or proposal should request a copy of the relevant bylaw provisions from our Corporate Secretary or refer to our bylaws as publicly filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that these time periods also apply in determining whether notice is timely for purposes of rules adopted by the SEC relating to the exercise of discretionary voting authority, which rules are separate from and in addition to the SEC requirements that a stockholder must meet in order to have a proposal included in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws also set out specific eligibility requirements that nominees for director must satisfy, which require nominees to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: complete and return a written questionnaire with respect to the background and qualification of the nominee and the background of any other person or entity on whose behalf the nomination is being made; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide a written representation and agreement that the nominee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will abide by the advance resignation requirements of our bylaws in connection with director elections;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is not and will not become a party to (1) any agreement, arrangement or understanding with, and has not given any commitment or assurance to, any person or entity as to how such prospective nominee, if elected as a director, will act or vote on any issue or question (a Voting Commitment) that has not been disclosed to us or (2) any Voting Commitment that could limit or interfere with the nominees ability to comply, if elected as a director, with the nominees fiduciary duties under applicable law;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is not and will not become a party to any agreement, arrangement or understanding with any person or entity other than us with respect to any direct or indirect compensation, reimbursement or indemnification in connection with service or action as a director that has not been disclosed therein; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if elected as a director, would be in compliance and will comply with all of our applicable corporate governance, conflict of interest, confidentiality and stock ownership and trading policies and guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding of Proxy Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC has adopted rules which permit companies and intermediaries such as brokers to satisfy delivery requirements for Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Material with respect to two or more stockholders sharing the same address by delivering a single Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Material addressed to those stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process, which is commonly referred to as householding, potentially provides extra convenience for stockholders and cost savings for companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We and some brokers household proxy materials, delivering a single proxy statement to multiple stockholders sharing an address unless contrary instructions have been received from the affected stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once you have received notice from your broker or us that they or we will be householding materials to your address, householding will continue until you are notified otherwise or until you revoke your consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, at any time, you no longer wish to participate in householding and would prefer to receive a separate proxy statement, or if you currently receive multiple proxy statements and would prefer to participate in householding, please notify your broker if your shares are held in a brokerage account or us if you hold registered shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can notify us by sending a written request to Express Scripts Holding Company, Attention: Investor Relations, One Express Way, Saint Louis, Missouri 63121, or by telephone at 314-810-3115, and we will promptly deliver these documents to you or start householding, as applicable, following our receipt of such request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokerage houses, banks, custodians, nominees and fiduciaries are being requested to forward the proxy material to beneficial owners and their reasonable expenses will be reimbursed by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitation will be made by mail and may also be made personally or by telephone, facsimile or other means by our executive officers, directors and employees, without special compensation for such activities.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
